document.docAuthor: Kononenko, Vladimir S., Volynkin, Anton V. & Yu, Alexei
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Xestia (Radddea) alexis (Kozhanchikov, 1928) species-group with a checklist of subgenus Raddea Alphéraky, 1892 and description of brachipterous females (Lepidoptera, Noctuidae, Noctuinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Xestia (Radddea) alexis (Kozhanchikov, 1928) species-group with a checklist of subgenus Raddea Alphéraky, 1892 and description of brachipterous females (Lepidoptera, Noctuidae, Noctuinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Estimata
Kozhanchikov, 1928
(Type-species:
Agrotis herrichschaefferi
Alphéraky, 1895
, by original designation) Estimaja
Kozhanchikov, 1937
. An unjustified emendation of
Estimata
Kozhanchikov, 1928

Erebophasma
Boursin, 1963
(Type-species:
Erebophasma haematina
Boursin, 1963
, ibidem 1170 : 75 , by original designation.

Diagnosis. In habitus, wing colouration and pattern
Raddea
species resemble some northern species of the subgenus
Pachnobia
(i.e.,
X . ( P .) aequaeva (Benjamin, 1934 )
,
X .( P .) alaskae (Grote, 1876 )
,
X .( P .) magadanensis
Kononenko & Lafontaine, 1983
) (
Figs. 25-32
). The subgenus
Raddea
is characterised by small size, hairy vesture of head and body, bipectinate male antennae, biserrate or filiform female antennae and basal segment of the mid tibia with four rows of setae laterally. Eyes rounded or slightly narrow; labial palps short, pressed or slightly extended; proboscis developed. In wing pattern, the lower part of the reniform is often produced towards the wing base. In the male genitalia, uncus short and broad, diamond-shaped, or widely lanceolate, tegumen short, with broad lobes, juxta often with hat-like central extension, or shield-like; vinculum strong, paratergal sclerites recurved, plate-like; valva relatively short, broad at base, tapering apically, in most cases bearing a short pollex at the apex, in some species pollex not expressed; costa strong, ending in a finger-like extension, which together with pollex forms a bifurcated tip of the valva; clasper rather long and strong, harpe short, flattened, located in distal third of the valva. Aedeagus short and strong, slightly curved, vesica short, projecting dorsally, bearing granulate cornuti or dentate sclerotised plate. Female brachypterous, with strongly reduced wings. In the female genitalia (described here for the first time in the subgenus based on the species
X. alexis
and
X. herrichschaefferi
), papillae anales elongate, covered with long hairs; apophyses posterior rather long, 3-5 times longer than anterior ones; 8 th segment ring-like, with incision in central part; ostium split-like; ductus bursae relatively short, wide, sclerotised; corpus bursae membranous, rounded or elongate.

Note. In the present treatment of the subgenus, we follow Lafontaine ( 1989 ), who joined the genera
Raddea
,
Estimata
and
Erebophasma
in the subgenus
Raddea
of
Xestia
. The taxa of the subgenus
Raddea
were described by several authors in the genera
Raddea
,
Estimata
and
Erebophasma
(
Kozhanchikov 1928
, 1937 ; Boursin 1940 ; 1963, 1964 ;
Bryk 1942
;
Dierl 1983
; Chen 1984, 1985 , 1991, 1993 ;
Hacker & Kautt 1996
[ 1997 ];
Hreblay & Ronkay 1998
), some other taxa were placed in these genera by
Boursin ( 1963
, 1964 ) and
Hreblay & Ronkay 1998
.
Kozhanchikov ( 1937 )
listed six species in
Estimata
, two of them (
oschi
and
militzae
) are synonyms of
alexis
;
herrichschaefferi
is a good species;
junctimacula Christoph, 1887
was designated as type-species of the genus
Xenophysa
Boursin, 1969
and separated from
Estimata
(
Boursin 1969
;
Varga 1989
), and
proterva Püngeler, 1904
is presently treated in
Rhyacia Hübner
, [ 1821 ] 1816 . Lafontaine ( 1998 ) transferred three species (
Estimata parvula Alphéraky
,
Estimata tibethophasma
Boursin, 1963
and
Estimata herzioides (Corti & Draudt, 1933 )
, placed by
Boursin ( 1963 )
to
Estimata
, to the genus
Perissandria Warren, 1909
of the tribe Agrotini . In the course of our examination of the original descriptions of the species described in
Raddea
,
Estimata
and
Erebophasma ,
we concluded that the taxon described from Northeast China as
Estimata dailingensis Chen, 1984
( type locality: China , Heilungjiang, Dailing, 390 m ) is a junior synonym ( syn. n. ) of
Protolampra sobrina (Duponchel, 1843 )
( Noctuidae , Noctuinae ), a boreal Eurasian species, distributed from West Europe to the Pacific border of North Asia. The taxon
Estimata magadanica
Kononenko, 1981
was transferred to Hyptioxesta by
Kononenko ( 1984 b)
, then to
Xestia
, subgenus
Pachnobia
by Lafontaine et al . ( 1998 ). The brachipterous female of this species was described by Kullberg et al. ( 1994 ). The systematic position of some species of the subgenus
Raddea
requires clarification.
